events.title: New Year's Day
events.description: New Year’s Day marks the beginning of the calendar year and is celebrated across the world as a time for renewal, hope, and fresh beginnings. It is rooted in the Gregorian calendar, which was adopted internationally for civil use. People often celebrate the day with family gatherings, cultural events, and public festivities. Many also use the occasion to reflect on the past year and set resolutions for personal or professional growth. Governments and organizations commonly observe it as a public holiday.

events.title: Hazarat Ali's Birthday
events.description: Hazarat Ali’s Birthday commemorates the birth of Ali ibn Abi Talib, the cousin and son-in-law of Prophet Muhammad and the first Imam in Shia Islam. He is revered for his wisdom, justice, courage, and deep commitment to ethical leadership. The day is observed through prayers, religious gatherings, and sermons highlighting his teachings and life values. Many believers also engage in acts of charity and community service to honor his legacy. {The date varies each year as it is observed according to the Islamic lunar calendar.}

events.title: World Braille Day
events.description: World Braille Day celebrates the importance of Braille as a means of communication for people who are blind or visually impaired. It marks the birth anniversary of Louis Braille, who invented the Braille system in the 19th century. The day was officially recognized by the United Nations to promote awareness about accessibility and inclusion. Organizations use the occasion to advocate for equal rights and access to information. Educational programs and campaigns highlight the role of Braille in empowering visually impaired individuals.

events.title: World Hindi Day
events.description: World Hindi Day promotes the global use and appreciation of the Hindi language. It commemorates the first World Hindi Conference held to strengthen Hindi’s international presence. The day is supported by the Government of India and Indian diplomatic missions worldwide. Literary events, seminars, and cultural programs are organized to celebrate Hindi literature and heritage. It also aims to encourage learning and use of Hindi beyond national boundaries.

events.title: National Youth Day
events.description: National Youth Day is observed to honor the ideals and teachings of Swami Vivekananda and inspire young people. The day emphasizes the role of youth in nation-building and social transformation. It was declared by the Government of India to encourage character building, discipline, and leadership among young citizens. Educational institutions organize speeches, workshops, and volunteer activities. The day highlights the power of youth as drivers of positive change.

events.title: Swami Vivekananda Jayanti
events.description: Swami Vivekananda Jayanti commemorates the birth of Swami Vivekananda, a renowned Indian philosopher and spiritual leader. He played a key role in introducing Indian philosophies of Vedanta and Yoga to the Western world. His teachings focused on self-belief, service to humanity, and national pride. The day is observed through lectures, youth programs, and spiritual discussions. His message continues to inspire generations toward personal growth and social responsibility. {The date may vary as it is based on the Hindu calendar.}

events.title: Lohri
events.description: Lohri is a popular winter harvest festival celebrated mainly in northern India. It marks the end of winter and the arrival of longer days after the solstice. The festival is deeply connected to agricultural traditions and seasonal change. People celebrate with bonfires, folk songs, dancing, and traditional foods. It holds special significance for newlyweds and newborns in families. {The date may vary slightly based on regional and traditional calendars.}

events.title: Pongal
events.description: Pongal is a multi-day harvest festival celebrated primarily in Tamil Nadu. It is dedicated to the Sun God and expresses gratitude for agricultural abundance. The festival symbolizes prosperity, renewal, and harmony with nature. Families prepare the traditional dish “Pongal” and decorate homes with kolam designs. It also includes honoring cattle and farmers for their role in cultivation. {The date varies as it follows the Tamil solar calendar.}

events.title: Makar Sankranti
events.description: Makar Sankranti marks the transition of the Sun into the zodiac sign Capricorn. It signifies the end of the winter solstice and the start of longer days. The festival is associated with harvest celebrations across India under different regional names. People celebrate by flying kites, sharing sweets, and taking holy dips in rivers. It represents renewal, positivity, and seasonal change. {The date can vary slightly based on solar calculations.}

events.title: Magha Bihu
events.description: Magha Bihu, also known as Bhogali Bihu, is a major harvest festival of Assam. It celebrates the end of the harvesting season and abundance of food. The festival is marked by community feasts, bonfires, and traditional games. People express gratitude for prosperity and share meals with family and neighbors. It reflects unity, joy, and cultural heritage. {The date varies according to the Assamese calendar.}

events.title: National Army Day
events.description: National Army Day honors the soldiers of the Indian Army and their service to the nation. It commemorates the day when the first Indian Commander-in-Chief took charge of the army. The occasion recognizes bravery, sacrifice, and discipline within the armed forces. Military parades and award ceremonies are held to mark the day. It strengthens public respect and appreciation for national defense personnel.

events.title: National Startup Day
events.description: National Startup Day celebrates innovation, entrepreneurship, and the startup ecosystem in India. It highlights the role of startups in economic growth and job creation. The day was established by the Government of India to encourage entrepreneurial culture. Events such as workshops, mentorship sessions, and startup showcases are organized nationwide. It aims to inspire young innovators and aspiring entrepreneurs.

events.title: Guru Govind Singh Jayanti
events.description: Guru Govind Singh Jayanti commemorates the birth of the tenth Sikh Guru, Guru Gobind Singh. He was a spiritual leader, poet, and warrior who founded the Khalsa. His teachings emphasized courage, equality, and devotion. Sikhs observe the day with prayers, processions, and community service. His legacy continues to shape Sikh identity and values. {The date varies as it is observed according to the Sikh and Hindu calendars.}

events.title: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Jayanti
events.description: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Jayanti honors one of India’s most prominent freedom fighters. He played a crucial role in India’s struggle for independence and led the Indian National Army. The day remembers his patriotism, leadership, and revolutionary ideals. Tributes, cultural programs, and educational events are organized across the country. His life continues to inspire courage and national pride.

events.title: National Girl Child Day
events.description: National Girl Child Day promotes awareness about the rights, education, and welfare of girls. It highlights issues such as gender equality, child marriage, and access to education. The day was initiated by the Government of India to support empowerment of girls. Campaigns and programs encourage positive societal change. It aims to create a safer and more equal future for girls.

events.title: International Day of Education
events.description: International Day of Education highlights the importance of education in achieving peace and sustainable development. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to recognize education as a fundamental human right. The day draws attention to global challenges such as access to quality learning and lifelong education. Governments and institutions organize discussions, campaigns, and educational events. It emphasizes education’s role in reducing inequality and empowering societies.

events.title: Republic Day
events.description: Republic Day marks the day India adopted its Constitution and became a sovereign republic. It symbolizes democratic values, rule of law, and national unity. The day is celebrated with grand parades showcasing India’s cultural diversity and military strength. Citizens participate in flag-hoisting ceremonies and patriotic programs. It serves as a reminder of constitutional rights and responsibilities.

events.title: International Customs Day
events.description: International Customs Day recognizes the role of customs agencies in facilitating global trade and security. It commemorates the establishment of the World Customs Organization. The day highlights efforts to ensure safe, efficient, and lawful cross-border movement of goods. Customs departments organize awareness programs and professional events. It emphasizes cooperation between nations to combat smuggling and illegal trade.

events.title: International Day of Clean Energy
events.description: International Day of Clean Energy promotes the transition toward renewable and sustainable energy sources. It was established by the United Nations to support climate action and energy access for all. The day highlights the role of clean energy in reducing pollution and combating climate change. Governments and organizations promote innovation and awareness initiatives. It encourages global cooperation for a greener future.

events.title: International Day of Commemoration in Memory of the Victims of the Holocaust
events.description: This day honors the memory of millions of Jews and other victims killed during the Holocaust. It was designated by the United Nations to preserve historical truth and prevent future genocides. The day promotes education about the dangers of hatred, racism, and antisemitism. Memorial ceremonies and educational programs are held worldwide. It reinforces the commitment to human dignity and justice.

events.title: Data Protection Day
events.description: Data Protection Day raises awareness about privacy rights and protection of personal information. It highlights the growing importance of data security in the digital age. The day encourages responsible handling of personal data by organizations and governments. Campaigns focus on cybersecurity, consent, and digital rights. It empowers individuals to safeguard their online information.

events.title: Guru Ravi Das's Birthday
events.description: Guru Ravi Das’s Birthday celebrates the birth of the revered saint and social reformer. He preached equality, compassion, and devotion beyond caste distinctions. His teachings emphasized spiritual unity and social justice. Devotees observe the day with prayers, hymns, and community service. His philosophy continues to inspire inclusive values. {The date varies each year as it is observed according to the Hindu calendar.}

events.title: World Wetlands Day
events.description: World Wetlands Day raises awareness about the importance of wetlands for ecosystems and human survival. It marks the adoption of the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands. The day highlights wetlands’ role in biodiversity, water purification, and climate regulation. Environmental organizations conduct conservation campaigns and educational programs. It encourages sustainable use and protection of wetland habitats.

events.title: International Day of Human Fraternity
events.description: International Day of Human Fraternity promotes peace, tolerance, and coexistence among people of all cultures and religions. It was established by the United Nations to strengthen global unity. The day emphasizes dialogue, mutual respect, and shared human values. Events include interfaith discussions and cultural exchanges. It encourages building a more inclusive and harmonious world.

events.title: International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation
events.description: This day aims to eliminate female genital mutilation worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to protect the rights and health of women and girls. The day raises awareness about the physical and psychological harm caused by the practice. Advocacy programs support survivors and promote legal reforms. It reinforces global commitment to gender equality and human rights.

events.title: World Pulses Day [FAO]
events.description: World Pulses Day highlights the importance of pulses in nutrition and sustainable agriculture. It is promoted by the Food and Agriculture Organization to encourage healthy diets. Pulses play a vital role in food security and soil health. The day raises awareness about their environmental and economic benefits. It supports sustainable farming practices worldwide.

events.title: International Day of the Arabian Leopard
events.description: International Day of the Arabian Leopard focuses on conserving this critically endangered species. It highlights the importance of biodiversity and wildlife protection. The day promotes awareness about habitat loss and environmental threats. Conservation groups organize campaigns to protect natural ecosystems. It encourages international cooperation for wildlife preservation.

events.title: International Day of Women and Girls in Science
events.description: This day promotes equal access and participation of women and girls in science and technology. It was established by the United Nations to address gender disparities in STEM fields. The day highlights achievements of women scientists worldwide. Educational events encourage young girls to pursue scientific careers. It supports innovation through diversity and inclusion.

events.title: Swami Dayananda Saraswati Jayanti
events.description: Swami Dayananda Saraswati Jayanti commemorates the birth of the founder of the Arya Samaj. He advocated social reform, Vedic education, and rational thinking. His teachings opposed social evils and promoted equality. The day is observed with lectures, prayers, and educational programs. His ideas continue to influence reformist thought in India. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu calendar.}

events.title: International Day for the Prevention of Violent Extremism as and when Conducive to Terrorism
events.description: This day highlights the need to address conditions that lead to violent extremism. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote peace and social resilience. The focus is on education, dialogue, and inclusive development. Governments and organizations work on prevention strategies and awareness programs. It emphasizes cooperation to counter radicalization and terrorism.

events.title: World Radio Day
events.description: World Radio Day celebrates radio as a powerful medium for communication, education, and cultural exchange. It was proclaimed by UNESCO to recognize radio’s role in reaching diverse and remote communities. The day highlights radio’s contribution to freedom of expression and access to information. Broadcasters organize special programs and discussions worldwide. It emphasizes radio’s relevance even in the digital age.

events.title: Maha Shivaratri
events.description: Maha Shivaratri is a major Hindu festival dedicated to Lord Shiva. It symbolizes spiritual awakening, self-discipline, and the victory of good over ignorance. Devotees observe fasting, night-long vigils, and special prayers at Shiva temples. The festival holds deep spiritual significance in Shaivism. It is believed to mark an auspicious cosmic event. {The date varies each year as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Global Tourism Resilience Day
events.description: Global Tourism Resilience Day highlights the need to strengthen the tourism sector against global crises. It was recognized by the United Nations to promote sustainable and resilient tourism practices. The day emphasizes preparedness, innovation, and recovery strategies. Governments and organizations discuss policies to protect livelihoods dependent on tourism. It supports long-term sustainability of the global travel industry.

events.title: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Jayanti
events.description: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Jayanti commemorates the birth of the founder of the Maratha Empire. He is remembered for his leadership, military strategy, and progressive governance. The day honors his contributions to Indian history and administration. Celebrations include processions, cultural programs, and historical discussions. His legacy continues to inspire ideals of justice and self-rule. {The date may vary as it is observed according to the Hindu calendar.}

events.title: World Day of Social Justice
events.description: World Day of Social Justice promotes fairness, equality, and inclusion in societies worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to address issues like poverty, unemployment, and social exclusion. The day highlights the importance of human rights and decent work. Governments and organizations hold discussions and awareness campaigns. It encourages collective action toward equitable development.

events.title: International Mother Language Day
events.description: International Mother Language Day celebrates linguistic diversity and multilingual education. It was proclaimed by UNESCO to honor language rights and cultural identity. The day raises awareness about preserving endangered languages. Educational institutions promote linguistic inclusivity and cultural heritage. It emphasizes language as a foundation of communication and identity.

events.title: World Thinking Day
events.description: World Thinking Day is observed by Girl Guides and Girl Scouts worldwide. It promotes global friendship, leadership, and social awareness. The day encourages young people to think about world issues and community service. Activities focus on empowerment and unity across cultures. It reflects the values of responsibility and global citizenship.

events.title: Central Excise Day
events.description: Central Excise Day recognizes the role of excise authorities in revenue collection and economic regulation. It marks the implementation of India’s Central Excise law. The day highlights the contribution of tax administration to national development. Officials conduct seminars and awareness programs. It promotes transparency and efficiency in taxation systems.

events.title: National Science Day
events.description: National Science Day commemorates the discovery of the Raman Effect by Sir C. V. Raman. It celebrates scientific achievement and innovation in India. Educational institutions organize exhibitions, lectures, and science fairs. The day encourages scientific temper and research culture. It highlights science’s role in national progress.

events.title: World Civil Defence Day
events.description: World Civil Defence Day emphasizes the importance of disaster preparedness and emergency response. It is observed to raise awareness about civil protection services. The day highlights the role of volunteers and authorities in saving lives. Training programs and drills are conducted worldwide. It promotes resilience against natural and man-made disasters.

events.title: Zero Discrimination Day [UNAIDS]
events.description: Zero Discrimination Day promotes equality and inclusion for all individuals. It is supported by UNAIDS to combat stigma, especially related to HIV/AIDS. The day encourages respect for human rights and diversity. Awareness campaigns focus on eliminating prejudice and inequality. It reinforces the message that discrimination harms societies.

events.title: World Seagrass Day
events.description: World Seagrass Day highlights the ecological importance of seagrass ecosystems. It raises awareness about their role in marine biodiversity and climate regulation. The day emphasizes conservation of coastal habitats. Environmental organizations promote sustainable marine practices. It supports global efforts to protect ocean life.

events.title: World Wildlife Day
events.description: World Wildlife Day celebrates the diversity of flora and fauna on Earth. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to raise awareness about wildlife conservation. The day highlights threats like habitat loss and illegal trade. Conservation activities and educational events are organized worldwide. It encourages protection of endangered species.

events.title: Dolyatra
events.description: Dolyatra is a traditional Hindu festival celebrated mainly in eastern India. It marks the arrival of spring and honors Lord Krishna. Devotees place idols on decorated swings and participate in cultural events. The festival is associated with joy and devotion. It is closely linked with seasonal change and tradition. {The date varies as it follows the Hindu calendar.}

events.title: Holi
events.description: Holi is the vibrant festival of colors celebrated across India. It symbolizes the victory of good over evil and the arrival of spring. People celebrate by throwing colors, singing, and sharing sweets. The festival promotes unity, joy, and forgiveness. It is rooted in ancient Hindu traditions. {The date varies each year as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day for Disarmament and Non-Proliferation Awareness
events.description: This day raises awareness about the importance of disarmament and preventing the spread of weapons. It was established by the United Nations to educate people, especially youth, about global security risks. The observance highlights the humanitarian and environmental impacts of weapons. Discussions, campaigns, and educational events are organized worldwide. It encourages international cooperation for lasting peace.

events.title: International Women's Day
events.description: International Women’s Day celebrates the achievements of women across social, economic, cultural, and political fields. It originated from early 20th-century labor movements advocating for women’s rights. The day also raises awareness about gender equality and women’s empowerment. Events include campaigns, seminars, and community programs. It serves as a global call to action for equal opportunities.

events.title: International Day of Women Judges
events.description: This day recognizes the contributions of women judges to justice systems worldwide. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote gender equality in the judiciary. The observance highlights the importance of inclusive and representative legal institutions. Conferences and discussions are held to inspire women in law. It supports equal access to justice for all.

events.title: International Day to Combat Islamophobia
events.description: The International Day to Combat Islamophobia promotes tolerance, understanding, and respect for religious diversity. It was designated by the United Nations to address discrimination and hatred against Muslims. The day raises awareness about the harmful effects of prejudice and misinformation. Educational programs and dialogues encourage peaceful coexistence. It reinforces the values of human rights and dignity.

events.title: Chaitra Sukladi
events.description: Chaitra Sukladi marks the beginning of the Hindu lunar year in several regions of India. It signifies renewal, prosperity, and fresh beginnings. The day is observed with prayers, rituals, and cultural traditions. Many communities consider it an auspicious time to start new ventures. It reflects the seasonal transition into spring. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Gudi Padava
events.description: Gudi Padava is the Marathi New Year celebrated mainly in Maharashtra. It symbolizes victory, prosperity, and new beginnings. Families raise a decorated gudi outside their homes and perform rituals. Traditional foods and cultural activities mark the celebration. The festival reflects regional heritage and optimism. {The date varies each year as it follows the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Ugadi
events.description: Ugadi marks the New Year in states such as Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka. It represents renewal, hope, and the cycle of time. People clean their homes, offer prayers, and prepare festive dishes like Ugadi pachadi. The festival blends spiritual reflection with celebration. It emphasizes balance in life’s experiences. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Cheti Chand
events.description: Cheti Chand is celebrated as the New Year by the Sindhi community. It honors the birth of Jhulelal, a revered spiritual figure. Devotees participate in processions, prayers, and cultural programs. The festival promotes harmony and gratitude. It holds deep religious and cultural importance. {The date varies according to the Hindu calendar.}

events.title: International Day of Happiness
events.description: The International Day of Happiness emphasizes the importance of happiness and well-being in human life. It was established by the United Nations to promote holistic development. The day highlights mental health, social connection, and positive living. People participate in activities that spread joy and kindness. It encourages policies that prioritize well-being.

events.title: French Language Day
events.description: French Language Day celebrates the French language and its cultural influence worldwide. It is observed to promote multilingualism and cultural diversity. The day highlights the role of French in diplomacy and education. Events include language workshops and cultural programs. It strengthens appreciation for linguistic heritage.

events.title: Jamat- Ul- Vida (Expected)
events.description: Jamat-Ul-Vida is observed on the last Friday of the holy month of Ramadan. It holds great spiritual significance for Muslims. Devotees gather for special prayers and sermons at mosques. The day emphasizes reflection, devotion, and community unity. It is considered one of the most sacred Fridays. {The date varies each year as it depends on the Islamic lunar calendar and moon sighting.}

events.title: International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination
events.description: This day raises awareness about the need to end racial discrimination worldwide. It was proclaimed by the United Nations in remembrance of victims of racial injustice. The observance promotes equality, dignity, and human rights. Educational events and campaigns highlight inclusion and justice. It encourages societies to reject racism in all forms.

events.title: World Poetry Day
events.description: World Poetry Day celebrates poetry as a form of artistic and cultural expression. It was established by UNESCO to support linguistic diversity and creativity. The day encourages reading, writing, and sharing poetry. Literary events and workshops are organized globally. It honors poets and their contributions to culture.

events.title: International Day of Nowruz
events.description: International Day of Nowruz celebrates the Persian New Year and the arrival of spring. It represents renewal, peace, and harmony with nature. The festival is observed with traditional rituals, meals, and cultural gatherings. It is recognized by the United Nations as an intangible cultural heritage. It strengthens bonds across communities. {The date may vary slightly depending on astronomical calculations of the vernal equinox.}

events.title: World Down Syndrome Day
events.description: World Down Syndrome Day raises awareness about Down syndrome and inclusion. It highlights the abilities and rights of people with Down syndrome. The day promotes acceptance, support, and equal opportunities. Awareness campaigns and community events are organized worldwide. It encourages respect and understanding in society.

events.title: World Day for Glaciers
events.description: World Day for Glaciers highlights the critical role glaciers play in regulating the Earth’s climate and freshwater supply. It was established to raise awareness about the rapid melting of glaciers due to climate change. The day emphasizes the environmental and social impacts on ecosystems and communities. Scientific discussions and awareness campaigns are organized globally. It encourages climate action and sustainable environmental practices.

events.title: International Day of Forests
events.description: The International Day of Forests celebrates the importance of forests for life on Earth. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote forest conservation and sustainable management. The day highlights forests’ role in biodiversity, climate regulation, and livelihoods. Tree-planting drives and educational programs are commonly held. It encourages protecting forests for future generations.

events.title: Id-ul-Fitr (Expected)
events.description: Id-ul-Fitr marks the end of the holy month of Ramadan and celebrates spiritual renewal. It is observed by Muslims worldwide with prayers, charity, and festive gatherings. The day emphasizes gratitude, compassion, and community bonding. Special prayers are held at mosques, followed by sharing meals with family and the needy. It is one of the most important Islamic festivals. {The date varies each year based on the Islamic lunar calendar and moon sighting.}

events.title: World Water Day
events.description: World Water Day focuses on the importance of freshwater and sustainable water management. It was initiated by the United Nations to address global water challenges. The day raises awareness about water scarcity, sanitation, and conservation. Campaigns and discussions are held worldwide. It promotes responsible use of water resources.

events.title: World Meteorological Day
events.description: World Meteorological Day commemorates the establishment of the World Meteorological Organization. It highlights the importance of weather, climate, and water-related sciences. The day focuses on improving forecasting and disaster preparedness. Educational programs and public awareness campaigns are organized. It emphasizes the role of meteorology in protecting lives and property.

events.title: World Tuberculosis Day
events.description: World Tuberculosis Day raises awareness about tuberculosis and efforts to eliminate it. It marks the discovery of the TB-causing bacterium by Dr. Robert Koch. The day highlights prevention, diagnosis, and treatment initiatives. Health campaigns and screenings are conducted globally. It aims to accelerate progress toward ending TB.

events.title: International Day for the Right to the Truth concerning Gross Human Rights Violations and for the Dignity of Victims
events.description: This day honors victims of gross human rights violations and promotes truth and justice. It was established by the United Nations to recognize the importance of accountability. The observance highlights the right of victims to know the truth. Memorial events and discussions are organized worldwide. It reinforces respect for human dignity and justice.

events.title: International Day of Remembrance of the Victims of Slavery and the Transatlantic Slave Trade
events.description: This day commemorates the victims of slavery and the transatlantic slave trade. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to educate people about this historical injustice. The observance promotes remembrance, reflection, and awareness. Educational programs and memorial events are held globally. It encourages efforts against racism and discrimination.

events.title: International Day of Solidarity with Detained and Missing Staff Members
events.description: This day honors UN staff and associated personnel who are detained or missing while serving. It highlights the risks faced by humanitarian workers worldwide. The observance raises awareness about their safety and rights. Events focus on advocacy and remembrance. It calls for protection and accountability.

events.title: World Theatre Day
events.description: World Theatre Day celebrates theatre as a form of artistic and cultural expression. It was initiated by the International Theatre Institute to promote performing arts. The day highlights theatre’s role in storytelling and social reflection. Performances and workshops are organized worldwide. It honors artists and creative communities.

events.title: Ram Navami
events.description: Ram Navami celebrates the birth of Lord Rama, a major deity in Hinduism. It symbolizes righteousness, devotion, and moral values. Devotees observe the day with prayers, fasting, and religious gatherings. Temples organize special rituals and readings from scriptures. The festival holds deep spiritual significance. {The date varies each year as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day of Zero Waste
events.description: The International Day of Zero Waste promotes sustainable consumption and waste reduction. It was established by the United Nations to address environmental challenges caused by waste. The day emphasizes recycling, reuse, and responsible production. Awareness campaigns and community initiatives are organized. It supports a circular economy and environmental protection.

events.title: Mahavir Jayanti
events.description: Mahavir Jayanti celebrates the birth of Lord Mahavira, the founder of Jainism. It emphasizes principles such as non-violence, truth, and compassion. Devotees participate in prayers, processions, and charitable acts. Temples organize special sermons and rituals. The day promotes peace and ethical living. {The date varies as it follows the Jain lunar calendar.}

events.title: April Fools Day
events.description: April Fools’ Day is observed as a day of humor and light-hearted pranks. It is celebrated in many countries around the world. People play harmless jokes and practical pranks on friends and family. Media and social platforms often participate playfully. The day promotes laughter and amusement.

events.title: World Autism Awareness Day
events.description: World Autism Awareness Day promotes understanding and acceptance of autism spectrum disorder. It was designated by the United Nations to highlight inclusion and support. The day focuses on the abilities and rights of individuals with autism. Awareness campaigns and community programs are organized globally. It encourages building an inclusive society.

events.title: Good Friday
events.description: Good Friday commemorates the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his sacrifice for humanity. It is one of the most solemn days in Christianity, observed during Holy Week. Churches hold prayer services, scripture readings, and moments of silence. Many believers fast and reflect on themes of sacrifice, forgiveness, and redemption. The day holds deep religious and spiritual significance. {The date varies each year as it is observed on the Friday before Easter, based on the Christian liturgical calendar.}

events.title: International Day for Mine Awareness and Assistance in Mine Action
events.description: This day raises awareness about the dangers of landmines and explosive remnants of war. It was established by the United Nations to support mine clearance and victim assistance efforts. The observance highlights the humanitarian impact of mines on civilians. Awareness campaigns and policy discussions are held globally. It promotes international cooperation to achieve mine-free communities.

events.title: International Day of Conscience
events.description: The International Day of Conscience promotes peace, tolerance, and mutual respect among individuals and nations. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to encourage ethical reflection and dialogue. The day emphasizes moral responsibility in addressing global challenges. Educational and awareness programs are organized worldwide. It encourages peaceful coexistence and harmony.

events.title: Easter Sunday
events.description: Easter Sunday celebrates the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead. It is the most important festival in Christianity, symbolizing hope and new life. Churches conduct special services, prayers, and celebrations. Families gather to share festive meals and traditions. The day represents victory over sin and death. {The date varies each year as it is determined by the lunar-based Christian calendar.}

events.title: International Day of Sport for Development and Peace
events.description: This day highlights the role of sport in promoting peace, development, and social inclusion. It was declared by the United Nations to recognize sport as a tool for positive change. The observance emphasizes teamwork, equality, and fair play. Sporting events and awareness programs are organized globally. It encourages using sport to bridge social divides.

events.title: World Health Day
events.description: World Health Day marks the founding of the World Health Organization. It focuses on raising awareness about global health issues and public well-being. Each year highlights a specific health theme of international importance. Health campaigns and outreach programs are conducted worldwide. The day promotes access to quality healthcare for all.

events.title: International Day of Reflection on the 1994 Genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda
events.description: This day commemorates the victims of the 1994 genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda. It was established by the United Nations to honor the memory of those who lost their lives. The observance promotes remembrance, reflection, and education. Memorial events and discussions are held globally. It reinforces the importance of preventing genocide and hatred.

events.title: International Day of Human Space Flight
events.description: The International Day of Human Space Flight celebrates humanity’s achievements in space exploration. It marks the anniversary of the first human spaceflight by Yuri Gagarin. The day highlights scientific progress and international cooperation in space. Educational programs and exhibitions are organized worldwide. It inspires future generations in science and exploration.

events.title: World Chagas Disease Day
events.description: World Chagas Disease Day raises awareness about Chagas disease and its impact on global health. It highlights the need for early diagnosis, treatment, and prevention. The observance focuses on communities affected by neglected tropical diseases. Health awareness campaigns are conducted worldwide. It aims to improve access to healthcare and reduce disease burden.

events.title: Vaisakhi
events.description: Vaisakhi marks the harvest festival and the formation of the Khalsa in Sikhism. It holds great religious and cultural importance for Sikhs and farming communities. Devotees visit gurdwaras, participate in prayers, and join processions. Cultural celebrations and community meals are common. The festival symbolizes renewal and unity. {The date varies slightly as it is based on the solar calendar.}

events.title: Vishu
events.description: Vishu marks the Malayalam New Year and symbolizes new beginnings. It is celebrated primarily in Kerala with traditional rituals. The Vishukkani arrangement is viewed as the first sight of the year. Families exchange gifts and enjoy festive meals. The festival represents prosperity and hope. {The date varies as it follows the regional solar calendar.}

events.title: Meshadi
events.description: Meshadi signifies the beginning of the solar New Year in several Indian traditions. It marks the Sun’s transition into the Aries zodiac sign. The day is associated with renewal and auspicious beginnings. People observe rituals and cultural customs. It reflects seasonal and agricultural cycles. {The date varies as it is determined by the solar calendar.}

events.title: World Art Day
events.description: World Art Day celebrates creativity and artistic expression across cultures. It was established to promote awareness of the arts and their contribution to society. The day honors artists and encourages creative freedom. Exhibitions, workshops, and cultural programs are organized worldwide. It highlights art’s role in fostering dialogue and innovation.

events.title: Vaisakhadi (Bengal)
events.description: Vaisakhadi marks the Bengali New Year and symbolizes renewal and prosperity. It is celebrated with traditional music, cultural programs, and festive meals. People wear traditional attire and exchange greetings. The day reflects cultural identity and heritage. It welcomes a fresh start for individuals and communities. {The date varies as it follows the Bengali solar calendar.}

events.title: Bohag Bihu (Assam)
events.description: Bohag Bihu marks the Assamese New Year and the beginning of the harvest season. It is the most important festival in Assam, celebrating nature and renewal. Traditional dances, music, and community feasts are central to the celebrations. The festival strengthens social bonds and cultural pride. It symbolizes joy, prosperity, and new beginnings. {The date varies as it is based on the regional solar calendar.}

events.title: Chinese Language Day
events.description: Chinese Language Day celebrates the Chinese language and its cultural significance worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to promote multilingualism and cultural diversity. The day highlights the history and influence of the Chinese script and literature. Educational events, language workshops, and cultural programs are organized globally. It encourages appreciation of linguistic heritage.

events.title: World Creativity and Innovation Day
events.description: World Creativity and Innovation Day recognizes creativity as a key driver of development and problem-solving. It was designated by the United Nations to encourage innovative thinking across societies. The observance highlights creativity in science, arts, education, and entrepreneurship. Workshops, exhibitions, and innovation challenges are organized worldwide. It promotes sustainable solutions through creative ideas.

events.title: International Mother Earth Day
events.description: International Mother Earth Day emphasizes the interconnectedness between humans and nature. It was established by the United Nations to promote environmental protection and sustainability. The day raises awareness about climate change and ecological balance. Environmental campaigns and tree-planting activities are common. It encourages responsible stewardship of the planet.

events.title: International Girls in ICT Day [ITU]
events.description: This day promotes the participation of girls and women in information and communication technologies. It was initiated by the International Telecommunication Union to bridge the gender digital divide. The observance highlights career opportunities in STEM fields. Mentorship programs, workshops, and awareness campaigns are held globally. It aims to empower young women through technology. {The date varies as it is observed on the fourth Thursday of April each year.}

events.title: World Book and Copyright Day [UNESCO]
events.description: World Book and Copyright Day celebrates books, reading, and intellectual property rights. It was established by UNESCO to promote literacy and protect authors’ works. The day highlights the importance of reading for education and cultural exchange. Book fairs, readings, and literary events are organized worldwide. It encourages lifelong learning through books.

events.title: English Language Day
events.description: English Language Day celebrates the English language and its global role in communication. It was established by the United Nations to promote multilingualism. The day highlights the literary and cultural contributions of the language. Educational and cultural events are organized worldwide. It encourages respect for linguistic diversity.

events.title: Spanish Language Day
events.description: Spanish Language Day honors the Spanish language and its cultural heritage. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote linguistic diversity. The observance highlights Spanish literature, history, and global influence. Cultural programs and language events are held internationally. It encourages cross-cultural understanding.

events.title: International Day of Multilateralism and Diplomacy for Peace
events.description: This day highlights the importance of multilateral cooperation in maintaining global peace. It was established by the United Nations to promote dialogue and collective action. The observance emphasizes diplomacy as a tool for conflict resolution. Discussions and policy events are held worldwide. It encourages international solidarity and cooperation.

events.title: World Malaria Day
events.description: World Malaria Day raises awareness about malaria prevention and control. It was established by the World Health Organization to support global elimination efforts. The day highlights progress and remaining challenges in combating the disease. Health campaigns and community outreach programs are organized worldwide. It promotes access to treatment and prevention.

events.title: International Delegate's Day
events.description: International Delegate’s Day recognizes the role of delegates in diplomacy and international cooperation. It commemorates the first meeting of the United Nations General Assembly. The observance highlights the importance of representation and dialogue. Educational programs and discussions are organized globally. It emphasizes peaceful international relations.

events.title: World Intellectual Property Day
events.description: World Intellectual Property Day highlights the role of intellectual property in encouraging innovation and creativity. It was established by the World Intellectual Property Organization. The day raises awareness about patents, copyrights, and trademarks. Seminars and awareness campaigns are held worldwide. It promotes respect for creators’ rights.

events.title: International Chernobyl Disaster Remembrance Day
events.description: This day commemorates the victims of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster. It was established by the United Nations to remember the long-term impacts of the tragedy. The observance highlights nuclear safety and disaster preparedness. Memorial events and educational programs are organized globally. It promotes awareness of environmental and health risks.

events.title: World Day for Safety and Health at Work
events.description: World Day for Safety and Health at Work promotes safe and healthy working conditions. It was initiated by the International Labour Organization to prevent workplace accidents. The observance highlights occupational safety standards. Awareness campaigns and training programs are held worldwide. It encourages protection of workers’ rights.

events.title: International Jazz Day
events.description: International Jazz Day celebrates jazz music and its role in promoting peace and unity. It was established by UNESCO to recognize jazz as a cultural bridge. The day highlights freedom of expression and creativity. Concerts and educational programs are organized globally. It encourages cultural dialogue through music.

events.title: Budha Purnima
events.description: Budha Purnima commemorates the birth, enlightenment, and death of Gautama Buddha. It is one of the most sacred festivals in Buddhism. Devotees visit temples, meditate, and participate in prayer ceremonies. Acts of charity and peace teachings are emphasized. The day symbolizes compassion, wisdom, and enlightenment. {The date varies as it is observed according to the lunar calendar.}

events.title: World Tuna Day
events.description: World Tuna Day highlights the importance of tuna conservation and sustainable fishing practices. It was established by the United Nations to raise awareness about overfishing and marine ecosystem balance. The day emphasizes the role of tuna in global food security and livelihoods. Educational campaigns and marine conservation programs are conducted worldwide. It promotes responsible consumption and protection of ocean resources.

events.title: World Press Freedom Day
events.description: World Press Freedom Day celebrates the fundamental principles of press freedom. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to support free, independent, and pluralistic media. The day honors journalists who risk their lives for truth and transparency. Discussions, awards, and awareness campaigns are organized globally. It emphasizes the role of media in democracy and accountability.

events.title: World Portugese Language Day
events.description: World Portuguese Language Day celebrates the Portuguese language and Lusophone cultures worldwide. It was established by UNESCO to promote linguistic diversity and cultural heritage. The observance highlights literature, history, and shared cultural identity. Cultural events and language programs are held internationally. It strengthens ties among Portuguese-speaking communities.

events.title: Time of Remembrance and Reconciliation for Those Who Lost Their Lives During the Second World War
events.description: This observance honors the victims of the Second World War. It was established by the United Nations to promote remembrance and reconciliation. The day reflects on the human cost of war and the importance of peace. Memorial ceremonies and educational programs are held worldwide. It encourages future generations to uphold peace and unity.

events.title: Birthday of Guru Rabindranath Tagore
events.description: This day commemorates the birth of Rabindranath Tagore, a Nobel Prize–winning poet and philosopher. He made significant contributions to literature, education, and cultural thought. The day is observed through literary programs, music, and cultural events. Educational institutions honor his works and teachings. It celebrates creativity, humanism, and cultural unity. {The date varies as it is observed according to the Bengali calendar.}

events.title: World Migratory Bird Day [UNEP]
events.description: This day raises awareness about the conservation of migratory birds and their habitats. It highlights threats such as climate change and habitat loss. The observance promotes international cooperation for wildlife protection. Nature walks and educational programs are organized. {The date varies as it is observed on the second Saturday of October.}

events.title: International Day of Argania
events.description: International Day of Argania highlights the importance of the argan tree and its ecosystem. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote sustainable development and biodiversity. The day emphasizes the role of argan forests in local livelihoods, especially for women. Educational and environmental activities are organized globally. It supports conservation and sustainable use of natural resources.

events.title: Vesak, the Day of the Full Moon
events.description: Vesak commemorates the birth, enlightenment, and passing of Lord Buddha. It is one of the most sacred festivals for Buddhists worldwide. Devotees participate in prayers, meditation, and acts of charity. Temples are decorated and community service activities are encouraged. The day symbolizes peace, compassion, and spiritual reflection. {The date varies as it is observed on the full moon of the lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day of Plant Health [FAO]
events.description: International Day of Plant Health raises awareness about protecting plants from pests and diseases. It was established by the United Nations and coordinated by FAO. The day highlights the role of plant health in food security and ecosystems. Educational campaigns and agricultural outreach programs are organized worldwide. It promotes sustainable farming and biodiversity protection.

events.title: International Day of Families
events.description: International Day of Families highlights the importance of families as fundamental units of society. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to address social, economic, and demographic issues affecting families. The day encourages awareness of family-related challenges. Community programs and discussions are organized globally. It promotes inclusive and supportive family policies.

events.title: International Day of Light
events.description: International Day of Light celebrates the role of light-based technologies in science and culture. It was established by UNESCO to highlight advances in optics and photonics. The observance promotes education and scientific cooperation. Lectures, exhibitions, and outreach programs are held worldwide. It emphasizes light’s role in sustainable development.

events.title: International Day of Living Together in Peace
events.description: This day promotes peace, tolerance, and coexistence among cultures and communities. It was established by the United Nations to encourage dialogue and solidarity. The observance highlights respect for diversity and mutual understanding. Educational and cultural programs are organized globally. It supports harmony and social cohesion.

events.title: World Telecommunication and Information Society Day
events.description: World Telecommunication and Information Society Day highlights the role of digital technologies in development. It was established by the International Telecommunication Union. The day raises awareness about bridging the digital divide. Conferences and technology-focused events are organized worldwide. It promotes inclusive access to information and communication technologies.

events.title: World Fair Play Day
events.description: World Fair Play Day celebrates fairness, integrity, and respect in sports and society. It promotes ethical behavior and mutual respect through athletic values. The observance highlights sportsmanship as a universal principle. Educational and sports-related events are organized globally. It encourages honesty and respect both on and off the field.

events.title: World Bee Day [FAO]
events.description: World Bee Day raises awareness about the importance of bees and pollinators. It was established by the United Nations and supported by FAO to protect biodiversity. The day highlights threats faced by pollinators due to environmental changes. Conservation campaigns and educational programs are organized worldwide. It promotes sustainable agriculture and ecosystem health.

events.title: International Tea Day
events.description: International Tea Day celebrates the cultural, economic, and social importance of tea worldwide. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to support tea workers and sustainable production. The day highlights tea’s role in livelihoods, especially in developing countries. Cultural programs, exhibitions, and awareness campaigns are held globally. It promotes fair trade and responsible consumption.

events.title: World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue and Development
events.description: This day celebrates cultural diversity as a driver of peace and development. It was established by UNESCO to promote intercultural dialogue and mutual understanding. The observance highlights the value of cultural expressions and traditions. Cultural events, discussions, and educational programs are organized worldwide. It encourages respect, inclusion, and global cooperation.

events.title: International Day for Biological Diversity
events.description: International Day for Biological Diversity raises awareness about the importance of biodiversity. It commemorates the adoption of the Convention on Biological Diversity by the United Nations. The day highlights threats to ecosystems and species. Conservation programs and educational activities are conducted globally. It promotes sustainable use of natural resources.

events.title: International Day to End Obstetric Fistula
events.description: This day focuses on ending obstetric fistula, a preventable childbirth injury. It was established by the United Nations to promote maternal healthcare access. The observance highlights the importance of skilled birth attendance. Awareness campaigns and healthcare initiatives are organized worldwide. It supports dignity and health for women and girls.

events.title: International Day of the Markhor
events.description: International Day of the Markhor celebrates the conservation of the markhor, a rare mountain goat species. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to highlight wildlife protection efforts. The day emphasizes biodiversity conservation and sustainable ecosystems. Awareness programs and conservation initiatives are promoted. It supports international cooperation in wildlife protection.

events.title: World Football Day
events.description: World Football Day celebrates football as a unifying global sport. It highlights the role of football in promoting teamwork, inclusion, and peace. The day encourages sports participation across communities. Friendly matches and sports events are organized worldwide. It emphasizes the positive social impact of sports.

events.title: Id-ul-Zuha (Bakrid)
events.description: Id-ul-Zuha, also known as Bakrid, commemorates the spirit of sacrifice shown by Prophet Ibrahim. It is one of the most important Islamic festivals. The day is observed through prayers, charity, and sharing meals. It emphasizes compassion, faith, and community bonding. {The date varies as it is observed according to the Islamic lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day of UN Peacekeepers
events.description: This day honors the service and sacrifice of United Nations peacekeepers. It commemorates the first UN peacekeeping mission. The observance recognizes their role in maintaining global peace and security. Ceremonies and tributes are held worldwide. It also honors those who lost their lives in service.

events.title: International Day of Potato [FAO]
events.description: International Day of Potato highlights the importance of potatoes in food security and nutrition. It was established by the United Nations and supported by FAO. The day emphasizes sustainable agriculture and rural development. Awareness campaigns and agricultural programs are organized globally. It promotes appreciation of this vital crop.

events.title: World No-Tobacco Day [WHO]
events.description: World No-Tobacco Day raises awareness about the harmful effects of tobacco use. It was established by the World Health Organization to promote tobacco control. The day highlights public health risks and prevention strategies. Health campaigns and policy discussions are conducted worldwide. It encourages healthier lifestyles and tobacco-free environments.

events.title: Global Day of Parents
events.description: Global Day of Parents recognizes the role of parents in nurturing children. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to honor parental commitment. The day highlights the importance of family values and child development. Awareness programs and family-centered activities are organized globally. It promotes responsible parenting and family well-being.

events.title: World Bicycle Day
events.description: World Bicycle Day celebrates cycling as a sustainable and healthy mode of transport. It was established by the United Nations to promote environmental and health benefits. The observance highlights accessibility and eco-friendly mobility. Cycling events and awareness campaigns are organized worldwide. It supports sustainable urban development.

events.title: International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression
events.description: This day highlights the suffering of children affected by conflict and violence. It was established by the United Nations to protect children’s rights. The observance raises awareness about child abuse and trauma. Educational and advocacy programs are conducted globally. It promotes peace and child protection.

events.title: World Environment Day
events.description: World Environment Day encourages global awareness and action for environmental protection. It was established by the United Nations Environment Programme. Each year focuses on a specific environmental theme. Clean-up drives and awareness campaigns are organized worldwide. It promotes sustainability and environmental responsibility.

events.title: International Day for the Fight against Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated Fishing
events.description: This day highlights the threat of illegal fishing to marine ecosystems. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote sustainable fisheries. The observance emphasizes ocean conservation and food security. Awareness campaigns and policy discussions are held globally. It supports responsible and legal fishing practices.

events.title: Russian Language Day
events.description: Russian Language Day celebrates the Russian language, its rich literary heritage, and cultural significance. It was established by UNESCO to promote multilingualism and cultural diversity. The observance highlights Russian literature, poetry, and arts. Cultural programs, literary readings, and language workshops are organized worldwide. It encourages appreciation of the Russian language and its contributions to global communication.

events.title: World Food Safety Day
events.description: World Food Safety Day raises awareness about the importance of safe food for health. It was established by the United Nations to prevent foodborne illnesses. The day highlights best practices in food production, handling, and consumption. Awareness campaigns, workshops, and policy initiatives are organized globally. It emphasizes the role of governments, businesses, and consumers in ensuring food safety.

events.title: World Oceans Day
events.description: World Oceans Day celebrates the importance of oceans for life on Earth. It was established by the United Nations to promote conservation and sustainable use of marine resources. The day highlights issues like pollution, overfishing, and climate change. Activities include beach clean-ups, educational programs, and awareness campaigns. It encourages global efforts to protect marine ecosystems and biodiversity.

events.title: International Day for Dialogue among Civilizations
events.description: This day promotes dialogue and understanding between different civilizations and cultures. It was established by the United Nations to encourage peace and tolerance. The observance highlights the importance of intercultural communication. Cultural events, conferences, and educational programs are organized worldwide. It fosters respect, cooperation, and global harmony.

events.title: International Day of Play
events.description: The International Day of Play celebrates the importance of play in child development and well-being. It was established to highlight physical, cognitive, and social benefits of play. Activities include community games, playground events, and educational programs. The day encourages children, families, and schools to prioritize playful learning. It promotes creativity, health, and social interaction.

events.title: World Day Against Child Labour
events.description: This day highlights the plight of children involved in exploitative labor. It was established by the International Labour Organization to eliminate child labor worldwide. The observance raises awareness about laws, education, and advocacy for children’s rights. Campaigns, workshops, and social initiatives are organized globally. It promotes education, protection, and safe childhoods.

events.title: International Albinism Awareness Day
events.description: This day raises awareness about the challenges faced by people with albinism. It was established by the United Nations to combat discrimination and violence. The observance highlights human rights, education, and healthcare needs. Awareness campaigns, educational activities, and advocacy programs are organized worldwide. It promotes inclusion, protection, and equality for people with albinism.

events.title: World Blood Donor Day [WHO]
events.description: World Blood Donor Day celebrates voluntary blood donors and raises awareness about the need for safe blood. It was established by the World Health Organization to save lives through blood donation. The observance emphasizes regular donations and safe transfusion practices. Campaigns, donor drives, and recognition events are held globally. It highlights solidarity and the importance of altruism.

events.title: World Elder Abuse Awareness Day
events.description: This day highlights the issue of elder abuse and the need to protect older people. It was established by the United Nations to raise awareness and promote prevention measures. The observance emphasizes the rights, dignity, and well-being of older adults. Workshops, campaigns, and advocacy programs are organized worldwide. It encourages communities to respect and support elders.

events.title: International Day of Family Remittances
events.description: This day recognizes the contributions of migrant workers who send remittances to support their families. It was established by the United Nations to highlight the economic and social impact of remittances. The observance emphasizes financial inclusion, security, and sustainable development. Awareness campaigns and financial literacy programs are organized globally. It promotes understanding of the role of remittances in improving lives.

events.title: World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought
events.description: This day raises awareness about desertification, land degradation, and drought impacts. It was established by the United Nations to promote sustainable land management. The observance highlights climate action, environmental protection, and sustainable agriculture. Campaigns, workshops, and educational events are held worldwide. It encourages global efforts to restore ecosystems and prevent land degradation.

events.title: Sustainable Gastronomy Day [FAO]
events.description: Sustainable Gastronomy Day celebrates the link between food, culture, and sustainable development. It was proclaimed by the United Nations and FAO to promote responsible food production and consumption. The observance highlights culinary traditions, local food systems, and environmental sustainability. Events include cooking demonstrations, workshops, and educational campaigns. It encourages mindful eating and protection of culinary heritage.

events.title: International Day for Countering Hate Speech
events.description: This day promotes awareness and action against hate speech worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to prevent discrimination and violence online and offline. The observance highlights human rights, equality, and respectful communication. Awareness campaigns, workshops, and discussions are conducted globally. It encourages tolerance, dialogue, and peaceful coexistence.

events.title: International Day for the Elimination of Sexual Violence in Conflict
events.description: This day raises awareness about sexual violence in conflict zones and promotes justice for victims. It was established by the United Nations to prevent sexual violence during wars and conflicts. The observance highlights advocacy, protection, and legal measures. Campaigns, educational programs, and policy discussions are organized worldwide. It encourages global commitment to ending sexual violence in conflicts.

events.title: World Refugee Day
events.description: World Refugee Day honors refugees and displaced persons globally. It was established by the United Nations to raise awareness of their plight and promote protection. The observance highlights human rights, safety, and humanitarian support. Events include cultural programs, advocacy campaigns, and educational initiatives. It encourages solidarity, compassion, and international cooperation.

events.title: International Day of Yoga
events.description: International Day of Yoga celebrates the ancient practice of yoga and its benefits for physical, mental, and spiritual well-being. It was established by the United Nations to promote health, harmony, and global unity. The day emphasizes yoga as a tool for stress reduction, mindfulness, and healthy living. Events include public yoga sessions, workshops, and demonstrations worldwide. Schools, communities, and organizations participate to spread awareness of the holistic benefits of yoga.

events.title: International Day of the Celebration of the Solstice
events.description: This day marks the solstice, the longest or shortest day of the year, depending on the hemisphere. It celebrates natural cycles and cultural traditions linked to the sun’s position. Communities around the world honor this day through rituals, festivals, and educational activities. The observance encourages connection with nature and recognition of seasonal changes. {The date varies based on the astronomical solstice each year.}

events.title: United Nations Public Service Day
events.description: United Nations Public Service Day honors the contributions of public service workers globally. It was established by the UN to recognize excellence in public administration and governance. The day highlights innovative solutions, transparency, and service to citizens. Ceremonies, awards, and conferences are organized to showcase outstanding achievements. It encourages good governance and inspires people to engage in public service.

events.title: International Widow's Day
events.description: International Widow’s Day raises awareness about the challenges faced by widows worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to highlight issues like discrimination, poverty, and social exclusion. The observance promotes support programs, advocacy, and empowerment initiatives. NGOs, governments, and communities organize events to provide assistance and recognition. {The date may vary in some countries according to local observances.}

events.title: International Day of Women in Diplomacy
events.description: This day celebrates the contributions of women in international diplomacy and peacebuilding. It was established to highlight gender equality, leadership, and representation in diplomatic roles. Observances include conferences, educational programs, and awards honoring women diplomats. The day encourages equal opportunities and the empowerment of women in foreign policy. It promotes awareness of women’s vital role in shaping global relations.

events.title: Day of the Seafarer
events.description: The Day of the Seafarer recognizes the invaluable contribution of seafarers to global trade and the economy. It was established by the International Maritime Organization to raise awareness about their working conditions and welfare. The day highlights maritime safety, training, and the role of seafarers in global supply chains. Ceremonies, workshops, and advocacy programs are organized internationally. It honors the dedication and sacrifices of seafarers worldwide.

events.title: Muharram
events.description: Muharram is the first month of the Islamic calendar and is observed as a period of mourning and reflection, particularly for the martyrdom of Imam Hussain. The day is marked with prayers, processions, and remembrance gatherings by the Muslim community. It emphasizes themes of sacrifice, justice, and spiritual renewal. The observance encourages reflection on moral values and historical events. {The date varies according to the Islamic lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day against Drug Abuse and Illicit Trafficking
events.description: This day raises awareness of the global drug problem and promotes prevention, treatment, and rehabilitation. It was established by the United Nations to highlight the dangers of drug abuse and the need for action against illicit trafficking. The observance includes educational campaigns, workshops, and law enforcement initiatives. It encourages governments, organizations, and communities to work together for drug-free societies.

events.title: International Day in Support of Victims of Torture
events.description: This day promotes awareness of the need to prevent torture and support survivors worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to uphold human rights and provide rehabilitation and legal aid. Observances include campaigns, educational programs, and advocacy initiatives. It highlights global solidarity and the commitment to justice and human dignity.

events.title: Micro-, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises Day
events.description: This day recognizes the contribution of micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) to sustainable development and economic growth. It was established by the United Nations to highlight entrepreneurship, innovation, and employment generation. Observances include workshops, networking events, and policy discussions. The day encourages support for MSMEs and fosters sustainable business practices.

events.title: International Day of Deafblindness
events.description: The International Day of Deafblindness raises awareness about people with combined vision and hearing impairments. It was established to promote accessibility, inclusion, and equal opportunities. The day highlights advocacy, education, and support services for the deafblind community. Events include workshops, exhibitions, and campaigns worldwide. It encourages society to recognize the needs and rights of individuals with dual sensory impairments.

events.title: International Day of the Tropics
events.description: This day celebrates the unique environmental, social, and economic aspects of tropical regions. It was established by the United Nations to promote sustainable development and resilience in tropical areas. Observances include conferences, educational programs, and campaigns highlighting biodiversity, climate change, and sustainable practices. It encourages global awareness of tropical challenges and opportunities.

events.title: International Asteroid Day
events.description: International Asteroid Day raises awareness about asteroid impacts and planetary defense. It was established by the United Nations to educate the public and promote scientific research on asteroid threats. Observances include educational workshops, seminars, and media campaigns worldwide. The day highlights the importance of space science, monitoring, and preparedness. It encourages global cooperation for the safety of Earth.

events.title: International Day of Parliamentarism
events.description: This day celebrates the role of parliaments in promoting democracy and good governance. It was established by the United Nations to highlight transparency, accountability, and citizen engagement. Observances include conferences, educational initiatives, and outreach programs. The day encourages dialogue, legislative innovation, and strengthening democratic institutions.

events.title: International Day of Cooperatives
events.description: International Day of Cooperatives recognizes the contribution of cooperatives to sustainable development and community empowerment. It was established by the United Nations to promote cooperative values like solidarity, equality, and mutual help. Observances include exhibitions, workshops, and awareness campaigns. The day encourages people to support cooperatives and community-based economic initiatives.

events.title: World Rural Development Day
events.description: World Rural Development Day highlights the importance of improving the quality of life in rural communities. It focuses on sustainable agriculture, infrastructure, education, and livelihoods for rural populations. The day emphasizes reducing poverty and inequality between urban and rural areas. Governments, NGOs, and international bodies organize discussions and development initiatives. It promotes inclusive growth and balanced regional development.

events.title: World Kiswahili Language Day
events.description: World Kiswahili Language Day celebrates Kiswahili as a unifying language across Africa and beyond. It was proclaimed by UNESCO to promote linguistic diversity and cultural heritage. The day highlights the role of Kiswahili in education, diplomacy, and social cohesion. Cultural programs, poetry, and language-learning activities are organized globally. It recognizes Kiswahili as one of the fastest-growing international languages.

events.title: World Population Day
events.description: World Population Day raises awareness about global population issues such as growth, health, gender equality, and development. It was established by the United Nations to focus attention on population trends and their impact. The day promotes access to healthcare, education, and family planning. Campaigns and discussions emphasize sustainable development and human rights. It encourages informed decisions about population-related challenges.

events.title: International Day of Reflection and Commemoration of the 1995 Genocide in Srebrenica
events.description: This day honors the victims of the 1995 genocide in Srebrenica and promotes remembrance and justice. It was established by the United Nations to acknowledge the atrocities and prevent future genocides. The observance emphasizes human rights, accountability, and reconciliation. Memorial ceremonies, discussions, and educational programs are held worldwide. It reinforces the importance of learning from history to protect humanity.

events.title: World Horse Day
events.description: World Horse Day celebrates the historical, cultural, and economic importance of horses to human civilization. It highlights the role of horses in transport, agriculture, sports, and companionship. The day promotes animal welfare and responsible care of horses. Events include exhibitions, educational programs, and equestrian activities. It recognizes the deep bond between humans and horses.

events.title: International Day of Combating Sand and Dust Storms
events.description: This day raises awareness about the environmental and health impacts of sand and dust storms. It was established by the United Nations to promote cooperation in managing land degradation and climate change. The observance highlights the need for sustainable land use and early warning systems. Educational campaigns and policy discussions are organized globally. It encourages joint action to reduce the risks caused by these natural phenomena.

events.title: International Day of Hope
events.description: International Day of Hope promotes optimism, resilience, and positive action in times of global challenges. The day encourages individuals and communities to focus on unity, compassion, and mental well-being. It highlights the power of hope in overcoming adversity. Activities include motivational events, community programs, and awareness campaigns. The observance inspires collective efforts toward a better future.

events.title: World Youth Skills Day
events.description: World Youth Skills Day highlights the importance of equipping young people with skills for employment and entrepreneurship. It was established by the United Nations to address youth unemployment and workforce readiness. The day focuses on technical, vocational, and digital skills. Workshops, training programs, and career guidance events are organized worldwide. It supports youth empowerment and sustainable economic growth.

events.title: Rath Yatra
events.description: Rath Yatra is a major Hindu festival celebrating the annual journey of Lord Jagannath, along with Lord Balabhadra and Goddess Subhadra. The festival is most famously celebrated in Puri, Odisha, with grand chariot processions. Devotees pull decorated chariots and participate in prayers and cultural events. The celebration symbolizes unity, devotion, and spiritual journey. {The date varies each year based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Nelson Mandela International Day
