events.description: Nelson Mandela International Day honors the legacy of Nelson Mandela and his commitment to peace, justice, and equality. It was established by the United Nations to encourage community service and social responsibility. The day inspires people to contribute positively to society through volunteerism. Activities include charity drives, educational programs, and awareness campaigns. It celebrates values of forgiveness, leadership, and human dignity.

events.title: World Chess Day
events.description: World Chess Day celebrates the game of chess and its contribution to intellectual development and strategic thinking. It marks the founding of the International Chess Federation (FIDE). The day highlights chess as a tool for education, concentration, and problem-solving. Tournaments, exhibitions, and learning sessions are organized globally. It promotes chess as a universal and inclusive game.

events.title: International Moon Day
events.description: International Moon Day commemorates human achievements in lunar exploration and space science. It was established by the United Nations to mark the first human landing on the Moon. The day promotes awareness of peaceful space exploration and scientific progress. Educational events, exhibitions, and discussions are held worldwide. It inspires interest in astronomy and future space missions.

events.title: World Drowning Prevention Day
events.description: World Drowning Prevention Day raises awareness about drowning as a major public health issue. It was established by the United Nations to promote water safety and preventive measures. The day emphasizes education, swimming skills, and community preparedness. Campaigns and training programs aim to reduce drowning-related deaths. It encourages global action to save lives through prevention.

events.title: International Day of Women and Girls of African Descent
events.description: This day recognizes the contributions, resilience, and rights of women and girls of African descent. It was established by the United Nations to address discrimination and promote equality. The observance highlights leadership, cultural heritage, and empowerment. Events include discussions, cultural programs, and advocacy initiatives. It promotes inclusion, dignity, and social justice.

events.title: International Day for Judicial Well-being
events.description: International Day for Judicial Well-being focuses on the mental and emotional health of judges and judicial professionals. It highlights the importance of well-being for maintaining justice, integrity, and fair decision-making. The day encourages support systems and stress management within the judiciary. Seminars and awareness programs promote healthier work environments. It emphasizes that judicial independence is strengthened through personal well-being.

events.title: World Hepatitis Day [WHO]
events.description: World Hepatitis Day raises awareness about viral hepatitis and its impact on global health. It is observed under the leadership of the World Health Organization to promote prevention, testing, and treatment. The day highlights the burden of liver disease caused by hepatitis B and C. Governments and health organizations conduct screenings and awareness campaigns. It encourages global action to eliminate hepatitis as a public health threat.

events.title: International Day of Friendship
events.description: International Day of Friendship celebrates the role of friendship in promoting peace, understanding, and solidarity among people and nations. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to encourage bonds across cultures and communities. The day highlights kindness, mutual respect, and social harmony. People celebrate by strengthening personal relationships and organizing community activities. It reminds societies that friendship can bridge differences and conflicts.

events.title: World Day against Trafficking in Persons
events.description: World Day against Trafficking in Persons raises awareness about human trafficking and the suffering of victims. It was established by the United Nations to promote prevention and protection of human rights. The day highlights issues such as forced labor, exploitation, and modern slavery. Campaigns focus on victim support, law enforcement, and public education. It calls for collective action to end human trafficking worldwide.

events.title: International Day of Awareness of the Special Development Needs and Challenges of Landlocked Developing Countries
events.description: This day highlights the unique economic and developmental challenges faced by landlocked developing countries. It was established by the United Nations to promote international cooperation and support. The observance focuses on trade barriers, infrastructure gaps, and limited access to global markets. Discussions and policy initiatives aim to promote sustainable development. It emphasizes the need for global partnerships to address geographic disadvantages.

events.title: International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples
events.description: International Day of the World’s Indigenous Peoples recognizes the cultures, traditions, and contributions of Indigenous communities worldwide. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote their rights and well-being. The day highlights issues such as land rights, education, and cultural preservation. Cultural events, discussions, and advocacy programs are organized globally. It supports inclusion, dignity, and respect for Indigenous identities.

events.title: World Steelpan Day
events.description: World Steelpan Day celebrates the steelpan, a musical instrument that originated in Trinidad and Tobago. It recognizes the cultural significance and global influence of steelpan music. The day promotes creativity, heritage, and musical education. Concerts, performances, and workshops are held worldwide. It honors the steelpan as a symbol of resilience and artistic expression.

events.title: International Youth Day
events.description: International Youth Day focuses on the role of young people in shaping a better future. It was established by the United Nations to highlight youth-related challenges and opportunities. Each year emphasizes themes such as education, employment, and social inclusion. Events include discussions, campaigns, and youth-led initiatives. It encourages youth participation in decision-making and development.

events.title: Independence Day
events.description: Independence Day marks India’s freedom from British colonial rule in 1947. It honors the sacrifices of freedom fighters and the nation’s journey toward sovereignty. The Prime Minister hoists the national flag and addresses the nation from the Red Fort. Celebrations include parades, cultural programs, and patriotic activities. The day symbolizes unity, democracy, and national pride.

events.title: Parsi New Year's day/ Nauraj
events.description: Parsi New Year, also known as Nauraj, marks the beginning of the new year in the Zoroastrian calendar. It is celebrated by the Parsi community with prayers, family gatherings, and festive meals. Fire temples hold special ceremonies for peace and prosperity. The day symbolizes renewal, gratitude, and hope. {The date varies based on the Zoroastrian calendar.}

events.title: World Humanitarian Day
events.description: World Humanitarian Day honors humanitarian workers who risk their lives to help people in crisis. It was established by the United Nations to recognize compassion and selfless service. The day raises awareness about humanitarian challenges worldwide. Campaigns highlight conflict zones, disasters, and aid efforts. It encourages global solidarity and support for humanitarian causes.

events.title: International Day of Remembrance and Tribute to the Victims of Terrorism
events.description: This day honors the memory of victims and survivors of terrorism worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to promote solidarity and support. The observance highlights the human cost of terrorism and the need for justice. Memorial events and awareness programs are held globally. It reinforces commitment to peace and human dignity.

events.title: International Day Commemorating the Victims of Acts of Violence Based on Religion or Belief
events.description: This day remembers victims of violence caused by religious intolerance and discrimination. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote freedom of religion and belief. The observance highlights the importance of tolerance and coexistence. Discussions and campaigns focus on preventing hate-based violence. It calls for unity, respect, and peaceful dialogue.

events.title: International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade and its Abolition
events.description: This day commemorates the victims of the transatlantic slave trade and honors those who resisted slavery. It was established by UNESCO to educate people about historical injustices. The observance highlights the lasting impact of slavery and racism. Educational programs and memorial events are organized worldwide. It promotes remembrance, reconciliation, and human rights.

events.title: Milad- un- Nabi or Id- e- Milad (Birthday of Prophet Mohammad)
events.description: Milad-un-Nabi marks the birth of Prophet Muhammad and celebrates his teachings of peace and compassion. The day is observed with prayers, sermons, and charitable activities. Mosques and homes are decorated, and religious gatherings are held. It emphasizes moral values, kindness, and unity. {The date varies based on the Islamic lunar calendar.}

events.title: Onam
events.description: Onam is a major harvest festival celebrated primarily in Kerala. It marks the legendary return of King Mahabali and symbolizes prosperity and unity. The festival features floral decorations, traditional dances, boat races, and grand feasts. Homes are decorated with flower rangolis called pookalams. {The date varies according to the Malayalam calendar.}

events.title: World Lake Day
events.description: World Lake Day highlights the importance of lakes in maintaining ecological balance and supporting livelihoods. It raises awareness about freshwater conservation, biodiversity, and climate impacts on lake ecosystems. The day encourages sustainable management and protection of lakes worldwide. Environmental groups and communities organize clean-up drives and awareness programs. It emphasizes the role of lakes in water security and sustainable development.

events.title: Raksha Bandhan
events.description: Raksha Bandhan celebrates the bond of love and protection between brothers and sisters. Sisters tie a rakhi on their brothers’ wrists as a symbol of care and affection. Brothers, in return, promise to protect and support their sisters. The festival strengthens family relationships and cultural values. {The date varies based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day against Nuclear Tests
events.description: This day raises awareness about the dangers of nuclear test explosions. It was established by the United Nations to promote a nuclear-weapon-free world. The observance highlights the environmental and human consequences of nuclear testing. Global discussions and campaigns advocate for disarmament and peace. It reinforces the need for international cooperation to end nuclear tests.

events.title: International Day of the Victims of Enforced Disappearances
events.description: This day honors victims who have disappeared due to enforced actions and supports their families. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to raise awareness about human rights violations. The observance calls for truth, justice, and accountability. Awareness campaigns highlight the need for legal protection and international action. It promotes dignity and remembrance for victims.

events.title: International Day for People of African Descent
events.description: This day celebrates the history, culture, and contributions of people of African descent worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to promote inclusion and equality. The observance addresses issues of discrimination, racism, and social justice. Cultural programs and discussions are organized globally. It supports dignity, development, and human rights.

events.title: Janmashtami (Vaishnva)
events.description: Janmashtami marks the birth of Lord Krishna, a central figure in Hinduism. Devotees observe fasts, sing devotional songs, and reenact episodes from Krishna’s life. Temples are decorated, and midnight prayers are offered to mark his birth. The festival symbolizes righteousness, love, and devotion. {The date varies according to the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day of Charity
events.description: International Day of Charity promotes generosity and support for humanitarian causes. It was established by the United Nations to encourage charitable activities worldwide. The day highlights the role of philanthropy in addressing poverty and crises. Organizations and individuals engage in donations and volunteer work. It inspires compassion and social responsibility.

events.title: International Day of Clean Air for Blue Skies [UNEP]
events.description: This day raises awareness about air pollution and its impact on health and the environment. It is supported by the United Nations Environment Programme to promote clean air solutions. The observance encourages governments and communities to reduce emissions. Campaigns focus on sustainable practices and policy action. It emphasizes the right to breathe clean air.

events.title: International Day of Police Cooperation
events.description: International Day of Police Cooperation highlights collaboration among law enforcement agencies worldwide. It marks the establishment of INTERPOL and its role in global security. The day emphasizes crime prevention, information sharing, and international coordination. Events promote professionalism and ethical policing. It strengthens trust and cooperation across borders.

events.title: World Duchenne Awareness Day
events.description: World Duchenne Awareness Day raises awareness about Duchenne muscular dystrophy. It highlights the challenges faced by patients and their families. The day promotes research, early diagnosis, and support services. Awareness campaigns encourage inclusion and medical advancement. It aims to improve quality of life for those affected.

events.title: International Literacy Day [UNESCO]
events.description: International Literacy Day emphasizes the importance of literacy for education and development. It was established by UNESCO to promote reading and writing skills worldwide. The observance highlights literacy as a foundation for equality and empowerment. Educational programs and campaigns are organized globally. It supports lifelong learning and social progress.

events.title: International Day to Protect Education from Attack
events.description: This day draws attention to attacks on students, teachers, and educational institutions. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to safeguard education during conflicts. The observance highlights the need for safe learning environments. Advocacy efforts promote international laws and protections. It reinforces education as a fundamental human right.

events.title: United Nations Day for South-South Cooperation
events.description: This day promotes collaboration among developing countries to achieve shared development goals. It highlights knowledge exchange, innovation, and mutual support. The United Nations encourages partnerships to address global challenges. Discussions focus on sustainable growth and solidarity. It strengthens cooperation among nations of the Global South.

events.title: Ganesh Chaturthi / Vinayaka Chaturthi
events.description: Ganesh Chaturthi celebrates the birth of Lord Ganesha, the remover of obstacles. Devotees install idols, offer prayers, and participate in cultural events. The festival ends with immersion ceremonies symbolizing renewal. It promotes unity, devotion, and environmental awareness. {The date varies based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day of Democracy
events.description: International Day of Democracy highlights the importance of democratic values and institutions. It was established by the United Nations to promote participation and human rights. The day encourages dialogue on governance and civic engagement. Events focus on freedom, equality, and the rule of law. It reinforces democracy as a foundation for peace and development.

events.title: International Day for the Preservation of the Ozone Layer
events.description: This day raises awareness about the importance of protecting the Earth’s ozone layer. It commemorates the signing of the Montreal Protocol, which aims to reduce substances that damage ozone. The observance highlights how ozone protection helps prevent harmful ultraviolet radiation. Governments and organizations promote environmental responsibility on this day. It also showcases global cooperation in addressing climate-related challenges.

events.title: International Day for Interventional Cardiology
events.description: This day recognizes the role of interventional cardiology in treating heart diseases using minimally invasive procedures. It highlights advancements such as angioplasty and stent placement that save lives. The observance promotes awareness of heart health and modern medical innovation. Medical professionals share knowledge and best practices. It emphasizes early diagnosis and effective treatment of cardiovascular conditions.

events.title: International Day of Science, Technology and Innovation for the South
events.description: This day highlights the role of science and technology in supporting development in the Global South. It was established by the United Nations to reduce technological gaps between nations. The observance promotes innovation, research, and digital inclusion. Discussions focus on sustainable development and problem-solving. It encourages global cooperation through scientific progress.

events.title: World Patient Safety Day
events.description: World Patient Safety Day focuses on improving safety in healthcare systems. It was established by the World Health Organization to reduce medical errors and harm. The day promotes safe practices for patients and healthcare workers. Awareness campaigns emphasize accountability and quality care. It aims to strengthen trust in healthcare services.

events.title: International Equal Pay Day
events.description: This day highlights the persistent gender pay gap worldwide. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote equal pay for work of equal value. The observance raises awareness about economic inequality and discrimination. Governments and organizations discuss fair wage policies. It supports gender equality and social justice.

events.title: World Cleanup Day
events.description: World Cleanup Day encourages people to take action against global waste and pollution. Millions of volunteers participate in clean-up drives across land and water bodies. The day promotes environmental responsibility and sustainable habits. It raises awareness about waste management and plastic pollution. {The date varies as it is observed on the third Saturday of September.}

events.title: International Day of Peace
events.description: This day promotes peace, harmony, and non-violence across the world. It was established by the United Nations to strengthen ideals of peace among nations. The observance encourages dialogue, tolerance, and conflict resolution. Peace events and campaigns are held globally. It reminds people of the importance of unity and cooperation.

events.title: International Day of Sign Languages
events.description: This day celebrates sign languages as full and equal languages of communication. It highlights the cultural and linguistic identity of deaf communities. The United Nations promotes inclusion and accessibility through this observance. Awareness programs focus on education and rights of deaf individuals. It supports equal participation in society.

events.title: World Maritime Day
events.description: World Maritime Day highlights the importance of the maritime industry in global trade and development. It is observed under the guidance of the International Maritime Organization. The day focuses on maritime safety, environmental protection, and innovation. Discussions address challenges faced by the shipping industry. {The date varies as it is observed on the last Thursday of September.}

events.title: International Day for the Total Elimination of Nuclear Weapons
events.description: This day emphasizes the urgent need to eliminate nuclear weapons. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to promote global disarmament. The observance highlights the humanitarian and environmental risks of nuclear arms. Advocacy efforts focus on peace and international security. It encourages cooperation toward a safer world.

events.title: World Tourism Day
events.description: World Tourism Day highlights the social, cultural, and economic importance of tourism. It is led by the World Tourism Organization to promote sustainable tourism. The observance focuses on responsible travel and cultural exchange. Events emphasize tourism’s role in development and employment. It encourages mindful and inclusive travel practices.

events.title: International Day for Universal Access to Information
events.description: This day promotes the right to seek and receive information. It was established by UNESCO to support transparency and accountability. The observance highlights freedom of information as a democratic principle. Discussions focus on digital access and open data. It empowers citizens through knowledge.

events.title: International Day of Awareness of Food Loss and Waste
events.description: This day raises awareness about reducing food loss and waste globally. It highlights the impact of waste on food security and the environment. The United Nations promotes sustainable consumption through this observance. Campaigns encourage better storage, distribution, and consumption habits. It supports global efforts to end hunger.

events.title: International Translation Day
events.description: International Translation Day recognizes the role of translators and interpreters in connecting cultures. It honors professionals who enable communication across languages. The day highlights the importance of linguistic diversity. Cultural and educational institutions mark the occasion worldwide. It promotes understanding and global cooperation.

events.title: International Day of Older Persons
events.description: This day focuses on the rights, dignity, and well-being of older persons. It was established by the United Nations to address aging-related issues. The observance highlights healthcare, social inclusion, and security for the elderly. Awareness programs promote respect and support for older generations. It emphasizes active and healthy aging.

events.title: Gandhi Jayanti
events.description: Gandhi Jayanti commemorates the birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, the leader of India’s freedom movement. It honors his principles of truth, non-violence, and peaceful resistance. The day is observed with prayer meetings, tributes, and cleanliness drives. Educational institutions reflect on his teachings and legacy. It also serves as a reminder of ethical leadership and social responsibility.

events.title: International Day of Non-Violence
events.description: This day promotes the principles of non-violence as advocated by Mahatma Gandhi. It was established by the United Nations to encourage peaceful conflict resolution. The observance highlights tolerance, dialogue, and mutual respect. Events focus on peace education and human rights. It reinforces non-violence as a universal value.

events.title: World Teachers' Day
events.description: World Teachers’ Day celebrates the role of teachers in shaping societies. It was established by UNESCO to recognize their contribution to education and development. The day highlights challenges faced by educators worldwide. Schools and institutions honor teachers through events and tributes. It emphasizes the importance of quality education for all.

events.title: World Habitat Day
events.description: World Habitat Day focuses on the state of human settlements and the right to adequate housing. It was established by the United Nations to promote sustainable urban development. The observance highlights issues like urban planning, housing, and inclusivity. Governments and organizations discuss sustainable cities. {The date varies as it is observed on the first Monday of October.}

events.title: World Cotton Day
events.description: World Cotton Day highlights the importance of cotton in global trade and livelihoods. It recognizes the role of cotton farmers, especially in developing countries. The day promotes sustainable cotton production. Discussions focus on fair trade and innovation. It supports economic growth and rural development.

events.title: World Post Day
events.description: World Post Day marks the anniversary of the establishment of the Universal Postal Union. It highlights the role of postal services in communication and commerce. The day celebrates connectivity across nations. Awareness programs focus on innovation in postal services. It recognizes postal workers worldwide.

events.title: World Mental Health Day
events.description: World Mental Health Day raises awareness about mental health issues globally. It promotes understanding, care, and support for mental well-being. The observance encourages open conversations to reduce stigma. Organizations and communities host awareness campaigns. It emphasizes access to mental health care for all.

events.title: World Migratory Bird Day [UNEP]
events.description: This day raises awareness about the conservation of migratory birds and their habitats. It highlights threats such as climate change and habitat loss. The observance promotes international cooperation for wildlife protection. Nature walks and educational programs are organized. {The date varies as it is observed on the second Saturday of October.}

events.title: International Day of the Girl Child
events.description: This day focuses on the rights and empowerment of girls worldwide. It addresses challenges such as education, health, and gender inequality. The United Nations promotes awareness through campaigns and discussions. The observance highlights the importance of equal opportunities. It supports the development and protection of girls.

events.title: International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction
events.description: This day promotes awareness about reducing risks from natural and human-made disasters. It was established by the United Nations to encourage preparedness and resilience. The observance highlights early warning systems and disaster planning. Governments and communities share best practices. It aims to save lives and reduce damage.

events.title: International Day of Rural Women
events.description: This day recognizes the contributions of rural women to agriculture and development. It highlights their role in food security and poverty reduction. The observance raises awareness about challenges faced by rural women. Programs promote gender equality and empowerment. It supports sustainable rural development.

events.title: World Food Day [FAO]
events.description: World Food Day raises awareness about hunger and food security. It is led by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations. The day promotes sustainable agriculture and nutrition. Campaigns focus on ending hunger worldwide. It emphasizes access to safe and nutritious food.

events.title: International Day for the Eradication of Poverty
events.description: This day highlights the global effort to end poverty in all its forms. It was established by the United Nations to promote dignity and human rights. The observance focuses on social inclusion and equality. Awareness programs highlight the voices of marginalized communities. It encourages collective action against poverty.

events.title: Dusshera (Saptami)
events.description: Dusshera Saptami marks the seventh day of the Durga Puja celebrations. It honors Goddess Durga and her divine power. Devotees participate in rituals and cultural programs. The day reflects themes of courage and righteousness. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Dusshera (Mahashtami)
events.description: Dusshera Mahashtami is one of the most significant days of Durga Puja. It commemorates Goddess Durga’s battle against evil forces. Special prayers and rituals are performed with devotion. Communities celebrate with music and cultural events. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Dusshera
events.description: Dusshera, also known as Vijayadashami, celebrates the victory of good over evil. It marks the defeat of Ravana by Lord Rama and the triumph of Goddess Durga over Mahishasura. The day symbolizes righteousness, courage, and moral values. Celebrations include burning effigies, processions, and cultural performances. It is observed across India with regional variations. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Dusshera (Mahanavmi)
events.description: Mahanavami is the ninth day of the Dusshera or Durga Puja festival. It honors Goddess Durga in her most powerful form. Devotees perform special prayers, rituals, and weapon worship in some traditions. Cultural programs and community gatherings mark the day. It represents strength, protection, and victory over negative forces. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: International Day of the Snow Leopard
events.description: This day raises awareness about the conservation of snow leopards and their fragile mountain ecosystems. It highlights threats such as climate change, habitat loss, and poaching. Governments and conservation groups promote protection efforts in high-altitude regions. Educational programs emphasize biodiversity and sustainable development. The day supports international cooperation for wildlife conservation.

events.title: United Nations Day
events.description: United Nations Day marks the anniversary of the UN Charter coming into force. It highlights the role of the United Nations in promoting peace, human rights, and global cooperation. The day reflects on international solidarity and diplomacy. Events include discussions, cultural programs, and awareness campaigns. It reinforces the importance of multilateral action.

events.title: World Development Information Day
events.description: This day focuses on raising awareness about development issues worldwide. It emphasizes the importance of sharing information for global progress. The United Nations promotes dialogue on economic and social development. Educational institutions and organizations host discussions and seminars. It supports informed decision-making for sustainable development.

events.title: Maharishi Valmiki's Birthday
events.description: Maharishi Valmiki’s Birthday honors the sage who authored the epic Ramayana. He is revered as one of the greatest poets and spiritual figures in Indian tradition. Devotees remember his teachings on morality and devotion. Temples and communities organize prayers and cultural events. The day celebrates wisdom and literary heritage. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: World Day for Audiovisual Heritage
events.description: This day highlights the importance of preserving audiovisual materials such as films, recordings, and broadcasts. It was established by UNESCO to protect cultural and historical records. The observance raises awareness about digital preservation challenges. Archives and institutions showcase their collections. It emphasizes safeguarding heritage for future generations.

events.title: International Day of Care and Support
events.description: This day recognizes the importance of care work and support systems in society. It highlights the role of caregivers in health, education, and social well-being. The United Nations promotes policies for inclusive care systems. Discussions focus on shared responsibility and dignity. The day supports social justice and equality.

events.title: Karaka Chaturthi (Karwa Chouth)
events.description: Karaka Chaturthi, popularly known as Karwa Chouth, is observed by married women for the well-being of their husbands. Women fast from sunrise to moonrise and perform traditional rituals. The festival symbolizes love, devotion, and marital bond. Families gather for prayers and celebrations. It is widely observed in northern and western India. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: World Cities Day
events.description: World Cities Day focuses on promoting sustainable urban development. It highlights challenges related to housing, infrastructure, and inclusivity. The United Nations encourages discussions on smart and resilient cities. Events include policy dialogues and awareness campaigns. The day emphasizes improving urban life for all.

events.title: International Day to End Impunity for Crimes against Journalists
events.description: This day raises awareness about violence against journalists worldwide. It promotes accountability and protection of press freedom. The United Nations highlights the importance of free and independent media. Events focus on safety, justice, and human rights. The observance supports transparency and democracy.

events.title: World Tsunami Awareness Day
events.description: World Tsunami Awareness Day promotes preparedness against tsunami risks. It emphasizes early warning systems and disaster education. The United Nations encourages international cooperation for disaster risk reduction. Awareness programs focus on saving lives and reducing damage. The day strengthens global resilience.

events.title: International Day for Preventing the Exploitation of the Environment in War and Armed Conflict
events.description: This day highlights the environmental impact of armed conflicts. It raises awareness about protecting natural resources during wars. The United Nations promotes international laws and cooperation. Educational programs focus on sustainability and peace. It emphasizes responsibility towards the environment.

events.title: Diwali (Deepavali)
events.description: Diwali, the Festival of Lights, celebrates the victory of light over darkness and good over evil. It marks Lord Rama’s return to Ayodhya and is also associated with Goddess Lakshmi. Homes are decorated with lamps, rangoli, and fireworks. Families gather for prayers, sweets, and celebrations. Diwali symbolizes prosperity, hope, and renewal. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Naraka Chaturdasi
events.description: Naraka Chaturdasi, also known as Choti Diwali, commemorates Lord Krishna’s victory over the demon Narakasura. It symbolizes the triumph of righteousness over evil. The day is observed with early morning rituals and lighting lamps. It marks the beginning of Diwali celebrations in many regions. The festival represents purification and spiritual renewal. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: Govardhan Puja
events.description: Govardhan Puja commemorates Lord Krishna lifting the Govardhan Hill to protect villagers from heavy rains. It emphasizes gratitude toward nature and divine protection. Devotees prepare large food offerings, symbolizing abundance and devotion. The festival is celebrated mainly in North India with prayers and community feasts. It highlights humility, faith, and respect for nature. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: World Science Day for Peace and Development
events.description: This day highlights the role of science in promoting peace and sustainable development. It was established by UNESCO to strengthen public awareness of science. Educational institutions organize lectures and exhibitions. The day encourages scientific cooperation across nations. It emphasizes responsible use of scientific advancements.

events.title: Bhai Duj
events.description: Bhai Duj celebrates the bond between brothers and sisters. Sisters perform rituals for their brothers’ well-being, while brothers offer gifts. The festival strengthens family relationships and mutual care. It is observed shortly after Diwali across India. Bhai Duj symbolizes love, protection, and harmony. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: World Diabetes Day
events.description: World Diabetes Day raises awareness about diabetes prevention and management. It was established by the International Diabetes Federation and WHO. Campaigns focus on healthy lifestyles and early diagnosis. The blue circle represents global unity against diabetes. The day supports education and public health initiatives.

events.title: Pratihar Shashthi or Surya Shashthi (Chhat Puja)
events.description: Chhat Puja is dedicated to worshipping the Sun God and Chhathi Maiya. Devotees observe strict rituals and fasting for family prosperity. Offerings are made at riverbanks during sunrise and sunset. The festival highlights discipline, gratitude, and environmental harmony. It is widely celebrated in Bihar, Jharkhand, and eastern Uttar Pradesh. {The date varies as it is based on the Hindu lunar calendar.}

events.title: World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims
events.description: This day honors victims of road traffic accidents worldwide. It raises awareness about road safety and responsible driving. Governments and NGOs promote preventive measures and policies. The observance supports affected families and survivors. It emphasizes saving lives through safer roads. {The date varies as it is observed on the third Sunday of November.}

events.title: International Day for the Prevention of and Fight against All Forms of Transnational Organized Crime
events.description: This day highlights global efforts to combat organized crime. It raises awareness about trafficking, corruption, and illegal trade. The United Nations promotes international cooperation and law enforcement. Discussions focus on justice and public safety. The day supports global peace and security.

events.title: International Day for Tolerance [UNESCO]
events.description: This day promotes mutual respect and understanding among cultures. It was established by UNESCO to combat intolerance and discrimination. Educational programs encourage dialogue and inclusion. The observance supports peaceful coexistence. It emphasizes unity in diversity.

events.title: World Day for the Prevention of and Healing from Child Sexual Exploitation, Abuse and Violence
events.description: This day raises awareness about protecting children from abuse and violence. It highlights prevention, healing, and survivor support. Governments and organizations promote child rights and safety. Educational campaigns encourage reporting and protection mechanisms. The day reinforces commitment to child dignity and justice.

events.title: World Toilet Day
events.description: World Toilet Day focuses on sanitation and access to clean toilets. It highlights the importance of hygiene for public health. The United Nations raises awareness about sanitation challenges worldwide. Campaigns emphasize dignity and disease prevention. The day supports Sustainable Development Goals.

events.title: World Philosophy Day [UNESCO]
events.description: This day encourages philosophical thinking and critical reflection. UNESCO established it to promote dialogue and intellectual inquiry. Academic institutions host discussions and lectures. Philosophy is highlighted as a tool for peace and understanding. The day supports freedom of thought. {The date varies as it is observed on the third Thursday of November.}

events.title: World Children's Day
events.description: World Children's Day promotes children's rights and well-being. It marks the adoption of the Convention on the Rights of the Child. UNICEF leads global awareness initiatives. Activities focus on education, health, and protection. The day celebrates children as the future of humanity.

events.title: Africa Industrialization Day
events.description: This day highlights Africa’s industrial development and economic growth. It was established by the United Nations to promote sustainable industrialization. Discussions focus on innovation and job creation. The observance supports regional development goals. It emphasizes inclusive economic progress.

events.title: World Television Day
events.description: World Television Day recognizes the influence of television in communication. It highlights television’s role in education and global awareness. The United Nations promotes its use for peace and development. Media discussions reflect on responsible broadcasting. The day emphasizes the power of visual media.

events.title: Guru Nanak's Birthday
events.description: Guru Nanak’s Birthday celebrates the birth of the founder of Sikhism. It highlights his teachings on equality, service, and devotion. Devotees participate in prayers, processions, and community meals. The festival promotes unity and compassion. It is observed with reverence across India and globally. {The date varies as it is based on the Sikh lunar calendar.}

events.title: Guru Teg Bahadur's Martyrdom Day
events.description: Guru Teg Bahadur's Martyrdom Day commemorates the sacrifice of the ninth Sikh Guru for religious freedom. He stood against forced conversions and defended the right to practice faith freely. The day highlights courage, tolerance, and human rights. Devotees remember his teachings through prayers and reflections. It reinforces the values of justice and sacrifice. {The date varies as it is based on the Sikh lunar calendar.}

events.title: World Conjoined Twins Day
events.description: World Conjoined Twins Day raises awareness about conjoined twins and their unique challenges. It promotes understanding, inclusion, and medical research. The day highlights the strength and resilience of individuals and families. Awareness campaigns focus on dignity and social acceptance. It encourages compassion and scientific advancement.

events.title: International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women
events.description: This day raises awareness about violence against women worldwide. It was established by the United Nations to promote gender equality and safety. Governments and organizations run campaigns and advocacy programs. The observance supports survivors and calls for stronger laws. It emphasizes zero tolerance for gender-based violence.

events.title: World Sustainable Transport Day
events.description: World Sustainable Transport Day promotes eco-friendly and accessible transportation systems. It highlights the role of transport in reducing emissions and improving quality of life. The United Nations encourages innovation and policy reforms. Discussions focus on public transport and clean energy. The day supports sustainable development goals.

events.title: International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People
events.description: This day highlights the rights and struggles of the Palestinian people. It was established by the United Nations to promote peace and justice. Educational programs and discussions are organized worldwide. The observance encourages dialogue and international cooperation. It emphasizes respect for human rights.

events.title: Day of Remembrance for all Victims of Chemical Warfare
events.description: This day honors victims of chemical weapons use across history. It raises awareness about the dangers of chemical warfare. The United Nations promotes disarmament and non-proliferation. Educational initiatives emphasize peace and accountability. The day supports global security efforts.

events.title: World AIDS Day
events.description: World AIDS Day raises awareness about HIV/AIDS and supports those affected. It promotes prevention, treatment, and ending stigma. Governments and organizations conduct health campaigns worldwide. The red ribbon symbolizes solidarity and hope. The day encourages global action toward ending AIDS.

events.title: International Day for the Abolition of Slavery
events.description: This day highlights the ongoing fight against modern slavery and human trafficking. It commemorates the adoption of the UN convention against exploitation. Awareness programs focus on forced labor and child slavery. The observance supports human dignity and justice. It calls for stronger international action.

events.title: International Day of Persons with Disabilities
events.description: This day promotes the rights and well-being of persons with disabilities. It encourages inclusion and accessibility in all areas of life. Governments and organizations raise awareness through campaigns and events. The observance supports equal opportunities. It emphasizes respect and empowerment.

events.title: International Day of Banks
events.description: International Day of Banks recognizes the role of banks in sustainable development. It highlights financial inclusion and economic stability. The United Nations promotes responsible banking practices. Discussions focus on innovation and resilience. The day supports global economic growth.

events.title: International Day against Unilateral Coercive Measures
events.description: This day raises awareness about the impact of unilateral sanctions on nations and civilians. It promotes dialogue and international cooperation. The United Nations highlights humanitarian consequences. Discussions focus on fairness and global justice. The day encourages peaceful conflict resolution.

events.title: World Soil Day [FAO]
events.description: World Soil Day highlights the importance of healthy soil for food security and ecosystems. It is led by the Food and Agriculture Organization. Awareness programs promote sustainable soil management. The day emphasizes conservation and climate resilience. It supports sustainable agriculture worldwide.

events.title: International Volunteer Day for Economic and Social Development
events.description: This day celebrates volunteers and their contribution to development. It was established by the United Nations to promote volunteerism. Organizations recognize community service worldwide. The observance highlights social responsibility. It encourages active citizenship and solidarity.

events.title: International Civil Aviation Day
events.description: International Civil Aviation Day recognizes the importance of global air transport. It highlights aviation’s role in connectivity and economic growth. The International Civil Aviation Organization promotes safe and sustainable aviation. Discussions focus on innovation and cooperation. The day supports global mobility.

events.title: International Anti-Corruption Day
events.description: This day raises awareness about corruption and its harmful effects. It was established by the United Nations to promote transparency. Governments and organizations encourage ethical governance. Campaigns focus on accountability and justice. The day supports fair and inclusive societies.

events.title: International Day of Commemoration and Dignity of the Victims of the Crime of Genocide and of the Prevention of this Crime
events.description: This day honors the memory and dignity of all victims of genocide across history. It was proclaimed by the United Nations to raise awareness about the causes and consequences of genocide. The observance emphasizes the responsibility of the international community to prevent such crimes. Educational programs and remembrance events are held to promote tolerance and human rights. The day serves as a reminder that early action and global cooperation are essential to prevent genocide.

events.title: Human Rights Day
events.description: Human Rights Day marks the adoption of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights by the United Nations in 1948. It highlights fundamental freedoms and dignity for all people. Governments, organizations, and institutions conduct awareness programs and discussions. The day promotes equality, justice, and respect. It reminds the world of shared responsibility in protecting human rights.

events.title: International Mountain Day
events.description: International Mountain Day raises awareness about the importance of mountains to ecosystems and livelihoods. It highlights the challenges faced by mountain communities. The United Nations promotes sustainable mountain development through this observance. Educational activities focus on conservation and climate impact. The day emphasizes protecting fragile mountain environments.

events.title: International Day of Neutrality
events.description: This day recognizes neutrality as a principle that promotes peace and diplomacy. It was established by the United Nations to encourage dialogue over conflict. The observance highlights peaceful conflict resolution methods. Discussions focus on international cooperation. The day supports stability and mutual respect among nations.

events.title: International Universal Health Coverage Day
events.description: This day promotes access to quality healthcare without financial hardship. It highlights the importance of strong and inclusive health systems. Governments and health organizations advocate policy reforms. Awareness campaigns emphasize equity in healthcare. The day supports global health and well-being goals.

events.title: International Day against Colonialism in All its Forms and Manifestations
events.description: This day condemns colonialism and its lasting impacts. It promotes self-determination and equality among nations. The United Nations highlights historical injustices and modern consequences. Educational programs encourage awareness and dialogue. The observance supports global justice and human dignity.

events.title: International Migrants Day
events.description: International Migrants Day recognizes the contributions of migrants worldwide. It highlights challenges such as displacement and discrimination. The United Nations promotes migrant rights and inclusion. Awareness campaigns encourage compassion and fair policies. The day supports safe and orderly migration.

events.title: Arabic Language Day
events.description: Arabic Language Day celebrates the Arabic language and its cultural heritage. It highlights Arabic’s contribution to literature, science, and philosophy. The United Nations promotes multilingualism through this observance. Educational events and cultural programs are organized worldwide. The day supports linguistic diversity.

events.title: International Human Solidarity Day
events.description: This day emphasizes unity and collective responsibility. It highlights solidarity as a core value for global cooperation. The United Nations encourages action against poverty and inequality. Awareness programs promote shared goals and empathy. The observance supports peace and sustainable development.

events.title: World Basketball Day
events.description: World Basketball Day celebrates the global impact of basketball as a sport. It highlights teamwork, inclusion, and cultural exchange. The United Nations recognizes basketball’s role in youth engagement and peace-building. Events and games are organized worldwide. The day promotes sportsmanship and unity.

events.title: World Meditation Day
events.description: World Meditation Day highlights the importance of mental well-being, inner peace, and mindfulness in daily life. It encourages people to practice meditation as a tool to reduce stress and improve emotional health. The day promotes awareness of mental balance in a fast-paced world. Governments, wellness organizations, and individuals take part through guided sessions and educational programs. It emphasizes the role of meditation in building compassion and clarity.

events.title: Hazarat Ali's Birthday
events.description: Hazarat Ali’s Birthday commemorates the birth of Imam Ali ibn Abi Talib, the cousin and son-in-law of Prophet Muhammad. He is respected for his wisdom, courage, and contributions to Islamic teachings. Devotees observe the day with prayers, sermons, and acts of charity. The occasion emphasizes justice, humility, and moral leadership. It holds deep spiritual significance in the Islamic faith. (The date varies each year as it is based on the Islamic lunar calendar.)

events.title: International Anti-Cybercrime Day
events.description: International Anti-Cybercrime Day raises awareness about the growing threat of cybercrime in the digital age. It highlights issues such as online fraud, identity theft, and cyber terrorism. The day encourages governments and organizations to strengthen cybersecurity measures. Educational programs promote safe and responsible internet use. It supports global cooperation to combat cyber-related crimes.

events.title: Christmas Eve
events.description: Christmas Eve marks the evening before the birth of Jesus Christ and is observed by Christians worldwide. It is a time of reflection, prayer, and family gatherings. Many attend midnight church services and participate in candlelight prayers. Traditions include decorating homes and preparing festive meals. The day symbolizes hope, peace, and anticipation.

events.title: Christmas Day
events.description: Christmas Day celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ, a central figure in Christianity. It is a major religious and cultural festival observed across the world. People attend church services, exchange gifts, and share festive meals. The day promotes values of love, generosity, and compassion. It brings families and communities together in celebration.

events.title: International Day of Epidemic Preparedness
events.description: International Day of Epidemic Preparedness emphasizes the importance of readiness to prevent and respond to disease outbreaks. It was established by the United Nations to promote global cooperation in public health. The day highlights lessons learned from past epidemics and pandemics. Governments and health organizations focus on strengthening healthcare systems. It encourages early action and global solidarity to protect lives.
